title: Geotechnical Investigation & Monitoring
description:
This module teaches students the essential concepts and
methodology for the planning, design and implementation of
site investigation and ground instrumentation programmes.
The module will be broadly divided into two parts. The first
part covers various aspects of site investigation such as the
planning, design, density of bore holes, sampling technology
and disturbance, in-situ and laboratory testing and
geophysical methods. The second part covers various
aspects of ground instrumentation such as monitoring of
ground movement, drawdown, excess pore pressures, strut
forces, wall deflection and observational methods. This
module enables students to acquire the knowledge and
practical skills through the lectures, case studies and
projects.
